1.40.text: The story of Souls Games have always revolved around bosses,

4.76.text: but that statement has never been more true than for Dark Souls 3.

1697.64.text: They needed someone to link the Flame, and for some reason, Lorian did not suffice,

1703.66.text: so they put their faith in the next born, Prince Lothric.

1707.90.text: As his throne states, "last hope of his line"

1712.96.text: Prince Lothrics, destined to be a Lord of Cinder,

1715.62.text: was born into swaddling clothes used in ancient prayer

1719.32.text: and they are all that he has ever worn.

1722.00.text: He was cherished by the Royal Family

1728.52.text: He was their last hope and meant to be a champion,

1732.34.text: but some things will remain distant dreams forever.

1801.84.text: and settled down far, far away to watch the fire fade from a distance.

1806.86.text: The curse has made their souls nearly inseparable.

1809.96.text: So, why did Lothric grow to despise and reject his duty as a Lord of Cinder?

1815.68.text: Well, it's very likely due to a man named as the First of the Scholars,

1822.68.text: he was alleged to be a private mentor of the Royal Prince

1826.30.text: and that he doubted the Linking of the Fire.

1872.86.text: Ever since Gwyn, the first Lord of Cinder,

1876.12.text: many exalted lords have linked the First Flame,

1885.16.text: The Soul of Cinder is their deific manifestation

1894.60.text: us from previous games and cycles who have linked the fire.
